question.title: Why does maven-clean-plugin fail to delete files after update from version 3.4.0 to 3.5.0
question.body:
I upgraded my plugins to current versions, specifically the maven-clean-plugin from 3.4.0 to 3.5.0, and the result was that any attempt to run mvn clean failed with a message that authorization to delete the files failed. Nothing else changed, just the version. I only experienced this problem for projects stored on OneDrive and only after the "target" folder was synchronized to the OneDrive Cloud. With synchronization turned off, 3.5.0 worked fine. With the project on a local drive 3.5.0 worked fine. With 3.4.0 everything worked fine.

PS C:\Users\myid\OneDrive\temp\demo> & mvn clean -f "c:\Users\myid\OneDrive\temp\demo\pom.xml"
[INFO] Scanning for projects...
[INFO] 
[INFO] --------------------------< com.example:demo >--------------------------
[INFO] Building demo 1.0-SNAPSHOT
[INFO]   from pom.xml
[INFO] --------------------------------[ jar ]---------------------------------
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- clean:3.5.0:clean (default-clean) @ demo ---
[INFO] Deleting c:\Users\Jerry F\OneDrive\temp\demo\target
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD FAILURE
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time:  1.299 s
[INFO] Finished at: 2025-09-11T13:12:21-04:00
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-clean-plugin:3.5.0:clean (default-clean) on project demo: Failed to clean project: Failed to delete C:\Users\Jerry F\OneDrive\temp\demo\target\classes\com\example -> [Help 1]
